snippet: The bank said in February that it had reached a preliminary settlement with the National Credit Union Administration but did not say how much it would pay.
abstract: Bank of America agrees to pay $165 million to settle accusations from National Credit Union Administration over sales of mortgage-backed securities to corporate credit unions that led them to fail.
lead_paragraph: The bank said in February that it had reached a preliminary settlement with the National Credit Union Administration but did not say how much it would pay.

headline.main: Bank Will Pay Credit Unions $165 Million in a Settlement
headline.print_headline: Bank Will Pay Credit Unions $165 Million in a Settlement
